original_title: Most Sri Lanka SLDB dollar bond holders agree to DDR
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – More than 94 percent of remaining holders of dollar denominated Sri Lanka Development Bond holders have agreed to exchange for longer term rupee bonds, a government statement said.
Out of 837.5 million dollars of remaining SLDBs, owners of 791.4 million dollars of bonds have offered to exchange and the offer has been accepted, the Finance Ministry said.
Of that 814.83 million was from institutional investors. Without individuals, 97.13 percent of holders have accepted the offer. With individuals, 94.49 percent have accepted the offer.
“On the Settlement Date, the Republic will issue New Bonds to Eligible Holders in accordance with the relevant Exchange Form submitted by each such Eligible Holder,” the statement said.
The government will also pay 69.31 million dollar equivalent of overdue interest in rupees.
